content: Anyone know a quick and easy way to display a node form (or any page really) in an overlay/modal?
If you find out, I'd like to know. :smile:
I'm interested as well, to link to an edit form from a contextual link in my case. Planning to deconstruct how the block system does it at some point.
Or (God forbid) port the Overlay module to Backdrop?
Don't think we need Overlay. I noticed that Views does it, and as @Laryn said, Layouts/blocks does it... Just need to work out how and see if we can replicate at will.
I'm thinking about using Featherlight, since one of my requirements is that users can close the modal by just clicking off it. But I'll play around and report back when I get a chance.

Ok, so Featherlight works:

<a href="#" data-featherlight="node/add/page #page-node-form">Add page</a>

The #page-node-form part after the URL is a selector that tells Featherlight which part of the page to display; in this case just the form (rather than the whole page (header, menu, footer, etc.)). While that looks much better, it unfortunately has the apparent effect of not loading the JS needed for certain form items (such as the vertical tabs). Looking into a fix for that now...

backdrop-contrib/featherlight
A very lightweight jQuery lightbox plugin. Contribute to backdrop-contrib/featherlight development by creating an account on GitHub.
Twas a joke re Overlay module @BWPanda :sweat_smile: ...I was about to mention https://api.backdropcms.org/change-records/dialog-api too.
Well that seems simpler! Didn't know about that. Thanks guys :smiling_face:
It seems that certain options are hard-coded and I can't change them using data-dialog-options="" (e.g. modal)

Giving up for now. I had trouble getting the width and height to be percentages - it seems you can only specify 'auto' or a pixel value... And if I try to style it with CSS, then it stuffs up the automatic styling.
